name: app.R
content:
#
# This is a Shiny web application. You can run the application by clicking
# the 'Run App' button above.
#

# Shiny-related UI libraries 
library(shiny)
library(shinyjs)
library(shinyWidgets)
library(bslib)
library(bsicons)

#Plot related libraries
library(plotly)
library(kableExtra)
library(tidyverse)

#Factorial Design related libraries
library(AlgDesign)


cards <- list(
  card(
    card_header("Interaction Plot"),
    min_height = 625,
    card_body(
      layout_columns(
        value_box(
          title = "Standard Deviation",
          value = textOutput("sd"),
          showcase = bs_icon("badge-sd-fill"),
        ),
        value_box(
          title = "Change in Health",
          value = textOutput("health_change"),
          showcase = bs_icon("heart-pulse-fill"),
        ),
      ),
      plotOutput("interaction_plot")
    ),

  ),
  card(
    card_header("ANOVA Table"),
    min_height = 10,
    tableOutput("anova")
  ),
  card(
    card_header("Factorial Design Table"),
    min_height = 10,
    uiOutput("design")
  ),
  card(
    card_header("Factorial Design Plot through Plotly"),
    min_height = 625,
    plotlyOutput("factorial")
  )
)


# Define UI for application
ui <- page_sidebar(
  useShinyjs(),
  # Application Bootswatch Theme
  theme = bs_theme(
    bootswatch = "journal"
  ),
  # Application title
  title = "Effects of Self-Efficacy on Post-Menopausal Women",
  
  # Mobile Friendly:
  fillable_mobile = TRUE,
  # Sidebar with a slider input for number of bins 
  sidebar = sidebar(
    title = "Health Dimensions",
    width = 300,
    fillable = TRUE,
    accordion_filters <- accordion(
      id = "dims",
      accordion_panel(
        "Physical Health",
        icon = bs_icon("heart-pulse-fill"),
        checkboxGroupButtons("phys",
                             "Select the following subfactors:",
                             choices = c("Nutrition", "Sleep", "Exercise"),
                             size = 'sm',
        ),
        div(id = "nutrition",
            card(
              card_header("Nutrition"),
              sliderTextInput("calorie_slider",
                              "Caloric Intake:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Below Target",
                                "At Target",
                                "Above Target")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("protein_slider",
                              "Protein Intake:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Below Target",
                                "At Target",
                                "Above Target")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("fat_slider",
                              "Fat Intake:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Below Target",
                                "At Target",
                                "Above Target")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("carb_slider",
                              "Carbohydrate Intake:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Below Target",
                                "At Target",
                                "Above Target")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("fasting_slider",
                              "Choose the type of fasting:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Dry",
                                "Water",
                                "Intermittent")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("other_nutr_slider",
                              "Choose how much of any other nutritional factor:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Below Target",
                                "At Target",
                                "Above Target")
              ),
            )
        ),
        div(id = "sleep",
            card(
              card_header("Sleep"),
              sliderInput("sleep_quan_slider", 
                          "Choose how many hours of Sleep:",
                          min = 0, max = 10, value = c(7,9)),
              sliderTextInput("sleep_qual_slider",
                              "Choose the quality of Sleep:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Terrible",
                                "Excellent")
              ), 
              sliderInput("sleep_eat_slider", 
                          "Choose how many hours since eating before bed:",
                          min = 0, max = 8, value = 3,
              ),
              sliderInput("screentime_slider", 
                          "Choose how much screentime before bed:",
                          min = 0, max = 5, value = 3,
              ),
              sliderInput("melatonin_slider", 
                          "Choose how many mgs of Melatonin are taken before bed:",
                          min = 0, max = 10, value = 0,
              ),
            ), # Added missing comma here
        ),
        div(id = "exercise",
            card(
              card_header("Exercise"),
              sliderTextInput("swim_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Swimming:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("run_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Running:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("walk_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Walking:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("hike_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Hiking:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("bike_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Biking:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("team_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Team Sport:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("weight_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Weightlifting:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
              sliderTextInput("other_exerc_slider",
                              "Choose the intensity of Other Exercise:",
                              grid = TRUE,
                              force_edges = TRUE,
                              choices = c(
                                "Moderate",
                                "Intense")
              ),
            )
        ),
      ),
      accordion_panel(
        "Social Health",
        icon = bs_icon("people-fill"),
        card (
          sliderInput("socialhours_slider", "Specify amount of hours socializing with non-friends per week:",
                      min = 0, max = 21, value = 10),
          sliderInput("vol_slider",
                          "Specify the amount of time a week spent doing community service:",
                      min = 0, max = 30, value = 10),
          sliderInput("friends_slider", "Specify the amount of hours socializing with friends per week:",
                      min= 0, max = 25, value = 10)
        )
      ),
      accordion_panel(
        "Mental Health",
        icon = bs_icon("person-circle"),
        card(
          sliderInput("read_slider", "Choose how many hours spent reading:",
                      min = 0, max = 15, value = 5),
          sliderInput("journal_slider", "Choose how many hours spent journalling:",
                      min = 0, max = 5, value = 3),
          sliderInput("mental_slider", "Choose how many hours engaging in an activity that promotes wellbeing:",
                      min = 0, max = 20, value = 2)
        )

      ),
      accordion_panel(
        "Spiritual Health",
        icon = bs_icon("yin-yang"),
        card(
          sliderInput("meditate_slider", "Choose how many hours a week spent meditating:",
                      min = 0, max = 5, value = 2),
          sliderInput("mindful_slider", "Choose how many hours a week are spent practicing mindfulness:",
                      min = 0, max = 5, value = 1),
          sliderInput("religious_slider", "Choose how many hours a week spent at a religious institution:",
                      min = 0, max = 10, value = 3),
          sliderInput("pray_slider", "Choose how many hours a week spent praying:",
                      min = 0, max = 3, value = 1),
          sliderInput("yoga_slider", "Choose how many hours a week spent doing yoga:",
                      min = 0, max = 5, value = 3),
          sliderInput("sacred_slider", "Choose how many hours a week are spent studying sacred texts:",
                      min = 0, max = 10, value = 2),
          sliderInput("spirit_slider", "Choose how many hours a week are spent on other spiritual activities:",
                      min= 0, max = 10, value = 2)
        )

      ),
    ),
  ),
  tabsetPanel(
    tabPanel(
      title = "Interaction Plot",
      cards[[1]], 
    ),
    tabPanel(
      title = "Design Cube(s)",
      cards[[4]]
    ),
    layout_columns(cards[[3]], cards[[2]])
  )
  
)

# Define server logic
server <- function(input, output) {
  f <- reactiveValues(
    data = NULL,
    design = NULL,
    result = NULL,
    std_dev = NULL,
    health_value = NULL
  )
  
  
  # Hide all the Sliders by default
  observe({
    isolate({
      shinyjs::hide("nutrition")
      shinyjs::hide("sleep")
      shinyjs::hide("exercise")
    })
  })
  
  observeEvent(input$phys,{
    # Hides all the Sliders
    shinyjs::hide("nutrition")
    shinyjs::hide("sleep")
    shinyjs::hide("exercise")
    
    # Dynamically shows slider based on which Subfactor is chosen:
    if ("Nutrition" %in% input$phys){
      shinyjs::show("nutrition")
    } 
    if ("Sleep" %in% input$phys){
      shinyjs::show("sleep")
    }
    if ("Exercise" %in% input$phys){
      shinyjs::show("exercise")
    } 
  })
  
  factorCalc <- reactive({
    # Create a vector of the number of levels for each factor
    levels <- c(2,2)
    
    # Factor names:
    factorNames <- c("Nutrition", 
                     "Sleep")
    
    # Generate the full factorial design
    design <- gen.factorial(levels, nVars = 2, varNames = factorNames)
    
    thickness<-c(rnorm(15, 2.5, 2.5), rnorm(15, 3, 2.5), 
                 rnorm(15, 3.5, 2.5), rnorm(15, 2, 2.5)
                 ) 
    
    Sleep_Hours <- c(rep("Insufficient",15), rep("Sufficient",15), 
                     rep("Sufficient",15), rep("Insufficient",15)
    ) 
    
    Exercise_Hours <- c(rep("Intense",30), rep("Moderate",30), 
                        rep("Intense",30), rep("Moderate",30)
    )
    
    data <- data.frame(Sleep_Hours, Exercise_Hours, thickness)
    
    A <- data$Sleep_Hours
    B <- data$Exercise_Hours
    Z <- data$thickness
    
    f$design <- design
    f$data <- data
    f$result <- aov(Z ~ A*B)
  })
  
# Function to generate summary without creating plots
  generate_summary <- reactive({
  # Ensure at least 2 health dimensions are selected
  if (length(input$phys) < 2) {
    print("Please select at least 2 subfactors for analysis.")
    return(NULL)
  }
  
    factorCalc()
    data <- f$data
    
    A <- data$Sleep_Hours
    B <- data$Exercise_Hours
    Z <- data$thickness
    
#TODO: Change plot_type to better fit input :)
  # Determine plot type based on selected items in input$phys
  selected_dimensions <- sort(input$phys)[1:2]  # Use first 2 selected dimensions
  plot_type <- paste(tolower(selected_dimensions), collapse = "_")
  
    if (plot_type == "sleep_exercise" | plot_type == "exercise_sleep") {
      # Calculate means and standard deviations without plotting
      means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
      sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
      
      # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
      mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
      mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
      diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
      pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
      
      # Standard deviation-based health improvement
      diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
      
      f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
      f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
      
    } else if (plot_type == "nutrition_sleep" | plot_type == "sleep_nutrition") {
      # Remove the interaction.plot call here
      means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
      sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
      
      # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
      mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
      mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
      diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
      pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
      
      # Standard deviation-based health improvement
      diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
      
      f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
      f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
      
    } else if (plot_type == "exercise_nutrition" | plot_type == "nutrition_exercise") {
      # Remove the interaction.plot call here
      means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
      sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
      
      # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
      mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
      mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
      int_suf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Intense"]
      
      # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
      diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
      pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
      
      # Standard deviation-based health improvement
      diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
      
      f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
      f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
      
    } else {
      showNotification("Invalid plot type. Please use a combination one of the following: 'sleep, exercise, and nutrition'.")
    }
  
  return(TRUE) # Return TRUE to indicate success
})

# Update the output renderers to handle the case when fewer than 2 dimensions are selected
  output$sd <- renderText({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2 || is.null(generate_summary())) {
    return("N/A")
  }
    return(f$std_dev)
  })
  
  output$health_change <- renderText({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2 || is.null(generate_summary())) {
    return("N/A")
  }
    return(paste0(f$health_value, "%"))
  })
  
  output$interaction_plot <- renderPlot({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2) {
    # Display a message if fewer than 2 dimensions are selected
    plot(0, 0, type = "n", axes = FALSE, ann = FALSE)
    text(0, 0, "Please select at least 2 subfactors under the Physical Health panel!", cex = 1.5)
    return()
  }
  
    factorCalc()
    df <- f$data
    A <- df$Sleep_Hours
    B <- df$Exercise_Hours
    Z <- df$thickness
    # Use the selected dimensions for plot labels
    selected_dims <- sort(input$phys)[1:2]
    interaction.plot(A, B, Z,
                      xlab = "Sleep Hours",
                      ylab = "Overall Health Score",
                     trace.label = "Exercise Hours")
  })
  
  output$factorial <- renderPlotly({
    # Define the Factors and Levels
    factors = 3
    levels = c(0,1)
    
    # Create factorial design grid reducing time complexity from O(N^3) to O(1)
    df <- expand.grid(
      sleep = levels, 
      exercise = levels, 
      nutrition = levels
    )
    
    # Add hovertext directly to the dataframe and factors
    df$sleep_hovertext <- ifelse(df$sleep == 0, "Low", "High")
    df$exercise_hovertext <- ifelse(df$exercise == 0, "Low", "High")
    df$nutrition_hovertext <- ifelse(df$nutrition == 0, "Low", "High")
    
    # Initialize plot
    plot <- plot_ly()
    
    # Define the edges of the cube as pairs of vertex indices
    edges <- list(
      # Bottom square
      c(1,2), c(2,4), c(4,3), c(3,1),
      # Top square
      c(5,6), c(6,8), c(8,7), c(7,5),
      # Vertical edges
      c(1,5), c(2,6), c(3,7), c(4,8)
    )
    
    # Define color scheme for factors
    factor_colors <- list(
      sleep = list(low = "firebrick", high = "royalblue"),
      exercise = list(low = "darkorange", high = "forestgreen"),
      nutrition = list(low = "purple", high = "turquoise")
    )
    
    # Function to determine which factor changes along an edge
    determine_changing_factor <- function(df, edge_indices) {
      v1 <- df[edge_indices[1], ]
      v2 <- df[edge_indices[2], ]
      
      if (v1$sleep != v2$sleep) return("sleep")
      if (v1$exercise != v2$exercise) return("exercise")
      if (v1$nutrition != v2$nutrition) return("nutrition")
      return("none")  # No change (shouldn't happen in a proper cube)
    }
    
    # Function to generate edge label based on which factor changes
    generate_edge_label <- function(df, edge_indices, factor) {
      v1 <- df[edge_indices[1], ]
      v2 <- df[edge_indices[2], ]
      
      # Determine direction of change
      if (factor == "sleep") {
        from_val <- v1$sleep_hovertext
        to_val <- v2$sleep_hovertext
      } else if (factor == "exercise") {
        from_val <- v1$exercise_hovertext
        to_val <- v2$exercise_hovertext
      } else if (factor == "nutrition") {
        from_val <- v1$nutrition_hovertext
        to_val <- v2$nutrition_hovertext
      } else {
        return("Edge")  # Fallback, shouldn't happen
      }
      
      # Create label with factor name and direction
      return(paste0(toupper(substr(factor, 1, 1)), substr(factor, 2, nchar(factor)), ": ", from_val, " â†’ ", to_val))
    }
    
    # Function to get edge color based on factor and values
    get_edge_color <- function(df, edge_indices, factor) {
      v1 <- df[edge_indices[1], ]
      v2 <- df[edge_indices[2], ]
      
      # For demonstration we'll use the "to" value to determine color
      if (factor == "sleep") {
        return(ifelse(v2$sleep == 0, factor_colors$sleep$low, factor_colors$sleep$high))
      } else if (factor == "exercise") {
        return(ifelse(v2$exercise == 0, factor_colors$exercise$low, factor_colors$exercise$high))
      } else if (factor == "nutrition") {
        return(ifelse(v2$nutrition == 0, factor_colors$nutrition$low, factor_colors$nutrition$high))
      }
      return("black")  # Fallback
    }
    
    # Draw all the edges on plotly with colors and labels
    for (i in 1:length(edges)) {
      edge <- edges[[i]]
      
      # Determine what factor changes along this edge
      changing_factor <- determine_changing_factor(df, edge)
      
      # Generate edge label
      edge_label <- generate_edge_label(df, edge, changing_factor)
      
      # Get edge color
      edge_color <- get_edge_color(df, edge, changing_factor)
      
      plot <- plot %>% add_trace(
        x = df$sleep[edge],
        y = df$exercise[edge],
        z = df$nutrition[edge],
        type = 'scatter3d',
        mode = 'lines',
        name = edge_label,
        line = list(color = edge_color, width = 6),
        hoverinfo = 'skip',  # Show the edge label on hover
        showlegend = TRUE    # Add to legend
      )
    }
    
    # Add all the points on plotly (vertices)
    plot <- plot %>% add_trace(
      x = df$sleep, 
      y = df$exercise, 
      z = df$nutrition, 
      type = 'scatter3d', 
      mode = 'markers', 
      name = "Factor Points",
      marker = list(
        size = 8,
        color = "black",
        symbol = "circle"
      ),
      hovertemplate = paste(
        "Sleep:",
        df$sleep_hovertext,
        "<br>",
        "Exercise:",
        df$exercise_hovertext,
        "<br>",
        "Nutrition:",
        df$nutrition_hovertext,
        # Extra removes to the trace number
        "<extra></extra>"
      )
    )
    
    # Add legends for factor levels
    for (factor in c("sleep", "exercise", "nutrition")) {
      # Add hidden traces just for legend entries
      plot <- plot %>% add_trace(
        x = c(NULL), y = c(NULL), z = c(NULL),
        type = 'scatter3d',
        mode = 'lines',
        line = list(color = factor_colors[[factor]]$low, width = 6),
        name = paste0(toupper(substr(factor, 1, 1)), substr(factor, 2, nchar(factor)), ": Low"),
        hoverinfo = 'none'
      )
      
      plot <- plot %>% add_trace(
        x = c(NULL), y = c(NULL), z = c(NULL),
        type = 'scatter3d',
        mode = 'lines',
        line = list(color = factor_colors[[factor]]$high, width = 6),
        name = paste0(toupper(substr(factor, 1, 1)), substr(factor, 2, nchar(factor)), ": High"),
        hoverinfo = 'none'
      )
    }
    
    # Layout configuration
    plot <- plot %>% layout(
      scene = list(
        xaxis = list(title = 'Sleep', range = c(-0.2, 1.2)),
        yaxis = list(title = 'Exercise', range = c(-0.2, 1.2)),
        zaxis = list(title = 'Nutrition', range = c(-0.2, 1.2))
      ),
      title = "3D Representation of a 2^k Factorial Design",
      legend = list(
        title = list(text = "Factors and Levels"),
        orientation = "h",
        yanchor = "bottom",
        y = -0.2
      )
    )
  })
  output$anova <- renderTable({
    factorCalc()
    anova(f$result)
  })
  
  output$design <- renderUI({
    factorCalc()
    data <- as.data.frame(f$design)
    HTML(
      kable(data, row.names = T)  |>
        kable_styling('striped',fixed_thead = T, full_width = F) |>
        column_spec(2,color= 'white',
                    background = spec_color(data$Nutrition,end = 0.7, option = 'A' )) |>
        column_spec(3,color= 'white',
                    background = spec_color(data$Sleep,end = 0.7, option = 'A' )) |>
        scroll_box(data, height = '400px')
    )

  })
  
  
}

# Run the application 
shinyApp(ui,server)

name: R/2k Factor Design.Rmd
content:
---
title: "2k Factorial"
author: "Rachel Hart"
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
output: html_document
---
```{r, echo = FALSE}
library(designr)
library(AlgDesign)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
library(plot3D)
```

```{r}
library(designr)
design1 <- 
  fixed.factor("Sleep", levels=c("Low", "High")) +
  fixed.factor("Exercise",  levels=c("Under 30 Minutes", "Over 30 Minutes")) +
  fixed.factor("Spirituality", levels =c("Under 20 minutes", "Over 20 Minutes")) +
  fixed.factor("Engagement", levels =c("Under 20 minutes", "Over 20 Minutes")) +
  fixed.factor("Nutrition", levels =c("Low", "High")) +
  fixed.factor("Cognition", levels =c("Low", "High")) 
design1

# Add more factors
# Make them dynamic based on a variable predetermined before (relate it to the menu and shiny and user input)
## Use paste to create the levels
```

```{r}
# Full factorial design
library(AlgDesign)

# Create a vector of the number of levels for each factor
levels <- c(2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2)

# Generate the full factorial design
design <- gen.factorial(levels, nVars = 3)
design
```

```{r}
#Create a vector column for thickness 
health<-c(rnorm(15, 4.5, 2.5), rnorm(15, 3.5, 2.5), rnorm(15, 5.5, 2.5), rnorm(15, 2.5, 2.5))

#Create the factors 
sleep <- c(rep("5",15), 
						rep("9",15), 
						rep("9",15), 
						rep("5",15)) 

exercise <- c(rep("60",15), 
					rep("30",15), 
					rep("60",15), 
					rep("30",15)) 

#Merge the data into a dataset 'data' 
data<- data.frame(sleep, 
				exercise, 
				health) 
data

#Assign the factors into variables 
A = data$sleep 
B = data$exercise 
Z = data$health 

result <-aov(Z ~ A*B) 

#Plot the anova table 
anova(result) 

#Plot the interaction plot 
interaction.plot(A, B, Z, 
				xlab = "Sleep", 
				ylab = "Health") 

```
# 3 Factor Simulated Interaction Plots
```{r}
health<-c(rnorm(15, 2.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 3.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 3.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 4.5, 1.5), 
          rnorm(15, 3.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 4.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 4.5, 1.5), rnorm(15, 5.5, 1.5))

#Create the factors 
sleep <- c(rep("Insufficient",15), 
						rep("Sufficient",15), 
						rep("Insufficient",15), 
						rep("Sufficient",15),
            rep("Insufficient",15), 
						rep("Sufficient",15), 
						rep("Insufficient",15), 
						rep("Sufficient",15))

exercise <- c(rep("Moderate",15), 
					    rep("Moderate",15), 
					    rep("Intense",15), 
					    rep("Intense",15),
					    rep("Moderate",15), 
						  rep("Moderate",15), 
						  rep("Intense",15), 
						  rep("Intense",15)) 

nutrition <- c(rep("Mindless",15), 
					  rep("Mindless",15), 
					  rep("Mindless",15), 
					  rep("Mindless",15),
					  rep("Purposeful",15), 
						rep("Purposeful",15), 
						rep("Purposeful",15), 
						rep("Purposeful",15))

#Merge the data into a dataset 'data' 
data <- data.frame(sleep, exercise, nutrition, health) 
data

#Assign the factors into variables 
A = data$sleep 
B = data$exercise 
C = data$nutrition
Z = data$health

```


```{r}
# Function to generate summary based on interaction plot choice
generate_summary <- function(plot_type, data) {
  
  if (plot_type == "sleep_exercise" | plot_type == "exercise_sleep") {
    interaction.plot(A, B, Z,  
                     xlab = "Sleep", 
                     ylab = "Health", trace.label = "Exercise")
    
    means <- tapply(data$health, list(data$sleep, data$exercise), mean)
    sd <- tapply(data$health, list(data$sleep, data$exercise), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    mod_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    mod_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
    
    cat("In this simulation, going from moderate exercise with insufficient sleep (mean health =", 
        round(mod_insuf, 2), ", SD =", round(mod_insuf_sd, 2), ") to intense exercise with sufficient sleep (mean health =", 
        round(int_suf, 2), ", SD =", round(int_suf_sd, 2), ") increases your health score by an average of", 
        round(diff_health, 2), "units, corresponding to an approximate", 
        round(pct_improve, 1), "% health improvement and", 
        round(diff_health_sd, 2), "standard deviation(s).\n")
    
  } else if (plot_type == "nutrition_sleep" | plot_type == "sleep_nutrition") {
    interaction.plot(C, A, Z,  
                     xlab = "Nutrition", 
                     ylab = "Health", trace.label = "Sleep")
    
    means <- tapply(data$health, list(data$nutrition, data$sleep), mean)
    sd <- tapply(data$health, list(data$nutrition, data$sleep), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf_nut <- means["Mindless", "Insufficient"]
    mod_suf_nut <- means["Mindless", "Sufficient"]
    int_suf_nut <- means["Purposeful", "Sufficient"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_nut_sd <- sd["Mindless", "Insufficient"]
    mod_suf_nut_sd <- sd["Mindless", "Sufficient"]
    int_suf_nut_sd <- sd["Purposeful", "Sufficient"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf_nut - mod_insuf_nut
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf_nut) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf_nut - mod_insuf_nut) / mod_insuf_nut_sd
    
    cat("In this simulation, going from mindless nutrition with insufficient sleep (mean health =", 
        round(mod_insuf_nut, 2), ", SD =", round(mod_insuf_nut_sd, 2), ") to purposeful nutrition with sufficient sleep (mean health =", 
        round(int_suf_nut, 2), ", SD =", round(int_suf_nut_sd, 2), ") increases your health score by an average of", 
        round(diff_health, 2), "units, corresponding to an approximate", 
        round(pct_improve, 1), "% health improvement and", 
        round(diff_health_sd, 2), "standard deviation(s).\n")
    
  } else if (plot_type == "exercise_nutrition" | plot_type == "nutrition_exercise") {
    interaction.plot(B, C, Z,  
                     xlab = "Exercise", 
                     ylab = "Health", trace.label = "Nutrition")
    
    means <- tapply(data$health, list(data$exercise, data$nutrition), mean)
    sd <- tapply(data$health, list(data$exercise, data$nutrition), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf_mind <- means["Moderate", "Mindless"]
    mod_suf_mind <- means["Moderate", "Purposeful"]
    int_suf_purp <- means["Intense", "Purposeful"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_mind_sd <- sd["Moderate", "Mindless"]
    mod_suf_mind_sd <- sd["Moderate", "Purposeful"]
    int_suf_purp_sd <- sd["Intense", "Purposeful"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf_purp - mod_insuf_mind
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf_mind) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf_purp - mod_insuf_mind) / mod_insuf_mind_sd
    
    cat("In this simulation, going from moderate exercise with mindless nutrition (mean health =", 
        round(mod_insuf_mind, 2), ", SD =", round(mod_insuf_mind_sd, 2), ") to intense exercise with purposeful nutrition (mean health =", 
        round(int_suf_purp, 2), ", SD =", round(int_suf_purp_sd, 2), ") increases your health score by an average of", 
        round(diff_health, 2), "units, corresponding to an approximate", 
        round(pct_improve, 1), "% health improvement and", 
        round(diff_health_sd, 2), "standard deviation(s).\n")
    
  } else {
    cat("Invalid plot type. Please use a combination one of the following: 'sleep, exercise, and nutrition'.\n")
  }
}

generate_summary("nutrition_sleep", data)
```

```{r}
for (j in 1:length(levels)) {
    for (i in 1:length(levels)) {
    x1 = c(x1, levels[i])
    x2 = c(x2, levels[j])
  }
}

twodf = data.frame(row.names =  c(1:length(x1)), x1,x2)

kable(twodf, row.names = T)  |>
  kable_styling('striped',fixed_thead = T, full_width = F) |>

  column_spec(2,color= 'white',
              background = spec_color(twodf$x1,end = 0.7, option = 'A' )) |>
  column_spec(3,color= 'white',
              background = spec_color(twodf$x2 ,end = 0.7, option = 'A' ))

plot_ly(twodf, x = ~x1, y = ~x2)
```

## Surface Plot

```{r}
vertices <- data.frame(
  x = c(0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 0), y = c(0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 1), z = c(0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 1))

edges <- list(c(1,2), c(2,3), c(3,4), c(4,1), c(5,6), c(6,7), c(7,8), c(8,5), c(1,5), c(2,6), c(3,7), c(4,8))

p <- plot_ly(threedf, x = ~sleep, y = ~exercise, z = ~nutrition)

for(edge in edges) {

  p <- add_trace(p,

                 x = vertices$x[edge],

                 y = vertices$y[edge],

                 z = vertices$z[edge],

                 type = "scatter3d",

                 mode = "lines",

                 line = list(width = 4, color = "#1f77b4")

  )

}

p <- add_trace(p,

               x = vertices$x,

               y = vertices$y,

               z = vertices$z,

               type = "scatter3d",

               mode = "markers",

               marker = list(size = 5, color = "#ff7f0e")

)

p <- add_trace(p, text = c("Sleep: Low, Exercise: Low, Nutrition: Low", "Sleep: High, Exercise: Low, Nutrition: Low", "Sleep: Low, Exercise: High, Nutrition: Low", "Sleep: High, Exercise: High, Nutrition: Low", "Sleep: Low, Exercise: Low, Nutrition: High", "Sleep: High, Exercise: Low, Nutrition: High", "Sleep: Low, Exercise: High, Nutrition: High", "Sleep: High, Exercise: High, Nutrition: High")) 

p <- layout(p,

            scene = list(

              xaxis = list(title = "Sleep", range = c(0, 1)),

              yaxis = list(title = "Exercise", range = c(0, 1)),

              zaxis = list(title = "Nutrition", range = c(0, 1)),

              aspectmode = "cube"  # ensures equal aspect ratio

            ),

            title = "2^3 Factorial Design Plot",
            showlegend = FALSE

)

p
```

name: test.R
content:
# Function to generate summary without creating plots
generate_summary <- reactive({
  # Ensure at least 2 health dimensions are selected
  if (length(input$phys) < 2) {
    showNotification("Please select at least 2 health dimensions for analysis.", type = "warning")
    return(NULL)
  }
  
  factorCalc()
  data <- f$data
  
  A <- data$Sleep_Hours
  B <- data$Exercise_Hours
  Z <- data$thickness
  
  # Determine plot type based on selected items in input$phys
  selected_dimensions <- sort(input$phys)[1:2]  # Use first 2 selected dimensions
  plot_type <- paste(tolower(selected_dimensions), collapse = "_")
  
  if (plot_type == "sleep_exercise" | plot_type == "exercise_sleep") {
    # Calculate means and standard deviations without plotting
    means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
    sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
    
    f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
    f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
    
  } else if (plot_type == "nutrition_sleep" | plot_type == "sleep_nutrition") {
    # Remove the interaction.plot call here
    means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
    sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
    
    f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
    f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
    
  } else if (plot_type == "exercise_nutrition" | plot_type == "nutrition_exercise") {
    # Remove the interaction.plot call here
    means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
    sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
    
    f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
    f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
    
  } else {
    # Default case for any other combination
    means <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), mean)
    sd <- tapply(Z, list(A, B), sd)
    
    # Extract specific scenarios for the summary
    mod_insuf <- means["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf <- means["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Extract standard deviations for these scenarios
    mod_insuf_sd <- sd["Insufficient", "Moderate"]
    int_suf_sd <- sd["Sufficient", "Intense"]
    
    # Calculate differences and approximate percentage improvement
    diff_health <- int_suf - mod_insuf
    pct_improve <- (diff_health / mod_insuf) * 100
    
    # Standard deviation-based health improvement
    diff_health_sd <- (int_suf - mod_insuf) / mod_insuf_sd
    
    f$std_dev <- round(diff_health_sd, 2)
    f$health_value <- round(pct_improve, 1)
  }
  
  return(TRUE) # Return TRUE to indicate success
})

# Update the output renderers to handle the case when fewer than 2 dimensions are selected
output$sd <- renderText({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2 || is.null(generate_summary())) {
    return("N/A")
  }
  return(f$std_dev)
})

output$health_change <- renderText({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2 || is.null(generate_summary())) {
    return("N/A")
  }
  return(paste0(f$health_value, "%"))
})

output$interaction_plot <- renderPlot({
  if (length(input$phys) < 2) {
    # Display a message if fewer than 2 dimensions are selected
    plot(0, 0, type = "n", axes = FALSE, ann = FALSE)
    text(0, 0, "Please select at least 2 health dimensions", cex = 1.5)
    return()
  }
  
  factorCalc()
  df <- f$data
  A <- df$Sleep_Hours
  B <- df$Exercise_Hours
  Z <- df$thickness
  
  # Use the selected dimensions for plot labels
  selected_dims <- sort(input$phys)[1:2]
  
  interaction.plot(A, B, Z,
                   xlab = selected_dims[1],
                   ylab = "Overall Health Score",
                   trace.label = selected_dims[2])
})
